		Hi,

I'm trying to evolve multiplexers with my own neuro-evolution method
and I've seen that Sharp-NEAT includes a 11-multiplexer
experiment (maybe someone tried the same experiment with another
implementation).

I have two questions :

- how many evaluations (population size & number of generations) are
  required to get a working 11-multiplexer ?

- what kind of neurons do you use (what activation function ?) ?

I would like to be able to try sharp-NEAT by myself but I've no access
to any windows machine and I don't have the time to fight with Mono.

Thanks.
-- 
Jean-Baptiste Mouret / Mandor
